name: Rosewood San Miguel de Allende

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is tops in its class, great service by all the personel, from the reception you feel welcomed, the grounds are beautiful and the building is new and clean. Location is just right, 10 minute walk to the downtown area. You also feel secure as the streets are well illuminated at night.
reviews.title: Excelente service and great location.

reviews.text: This property has two reataurants and a bar near the pool, the 1826 Restaurant and Bar that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, and the Luna Bar, that serves tapas, drinks and some food on evenings. Both are good and have a nice selection of food and drinks. Most of them are on the pricey side so choose wisely, but you´ll get very good quality food. We tried breakfast on the 1826 restaurant and everything was outstanding, food and service. We did not use the pool so can´t say anithing about the Aqua bar service.
reviews.title: A great place of value that makes you feel apreciated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa, Sense, has a good menu of services, we tried a couples spa service and it was very good, their staff is well prepared and they gave us a great massage. You can use their sauna and vapor areas as well. They have very nice ammenities in the spa, you can have a cup of tea in between treatments and some snacks. Our experience can be descibed as excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in San Miguel

reviews.text: The rooms are huge and very nicely decorated, great bathroom and balcony. The only thing was the bed, it did not feel confortable, by the second night I had back pain, but probably it was just me.
reviews.title: A million dollar view, food acceptable

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is a most excellent choice in San Miguel de Allende, you get a lot more for the price.
reviews.title: A wonderful weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I did not stay here, my wife and I had 2 meals here and also spent a day at the spa. We have visited San Miguel many times and what has always been missing is a property of this magnitude. The size of the property might discourage some, but Rosewood does it very well. Architecturally and aesthetically the property is very pleasing to the eye and many local touches are present. The restaurant is fantastic and the food was perfect.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: Sense (the Spa) was small but still had all of the amenities you would expect (short of its own pool). The treatments were performed very well and ranked among the best we have ever had. My only complaint would be that approx 1 month prior to our visit I sent the spa a email via their own email address (found on their web site) and I never received a response. Luckily upon our arrival there were openings.
reviews.title: Great Property, Staff, Restaurant and Value...

reviews.text: With two months of traveling in 2012 the single greatest highlight was our stay at the Rosewood San Miguel de Allende. No strangers to San Miguel with a few months living there while attending language schools in the past twenty years, not only was the Rosewood 'as good as it gets' in every respect, the rates were fair when considering the quality. For comparable in Puerta Vallarta and Cabo San Lucas you can double or triple the rate at the Four and Five Diamond level.
reviews.title: Up to rosewood standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read an earlier review where the 'critic' felt it was too 'American'. Amazing, it's as authentic 'Mexicano' as one could ever hope to find in a re-creation of a Spanish Colonial property. Amazing construction, well trained staff, excellent cuisine...I don't know where to stop, so we will be returning in 2013.
reviews.title: Dia de Los Muertos

reviews.text: Great hotel a couple of blocks from the center of the city where all the sightseeing takes place. Rooms are fabulous and the food is amazing. The hotel blends in with the colonial arquitecture of San Miguel buy has all the amenities you bare used to. Definitely coming back ASAP
reviews.title: Hard to describe without missing the place greatness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was luxury , everything was wonderful . Best food I have ever had in San Migual , and I have eaten there a lot .The staff are most pleasent and well trained. Service was wonderful It was nice and close to the town square so we walked everywhere. They tried to up our bill by adding on minibar items ( I had no idea we had a minibar) , this took a while to sort out . All in all very relaxing . Having stayed in many hotels in San Migual , Im not sure id pay $650+ for a room per night again , however I did enjoy my weekend there.
reviews.title: I fealt like a Queen !

reviews.text: For a first-timer to Mexico this hotel is a great choice. Solid luxury, safe environment. However, if you have seen a lot in Mexico, the Rosewood comes across as too American, not authentically Mexican. Service can be mixed, with some staff speaking only Spanish (e.g. valet). The pool area is rather bland, not very atmospheric (how about some palms or cactuses ?). The city itself is an unfortunate tourist trap and traffic can be hell.
reviews.title: Solid US quality in Mexican tourist trap

reviews.text: The architeture of the hotel is really impressive! All the hotel, including bedroooms (wich are huge) are decorated in colonial style but everything in perfect conditions and total confort.
reviews.title: Luxury inside a colonial style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That's definitelly a 5 star hotel in a magic city.
reviews.title: Absolute Perfection!

reviews.text: Absolute Perfection! All the staff made everything they could to make us feel like kings. The kind words, notes and gifts from the hotel members made a extraordinary difference in our engachement anniversary and specially for my wife's birthday. Likely the best view, drinks, and food in San Miguel de Allende.
reviews.title: Love the view, service, drinks and tapas!
The best hotel experience I've ever experienced!
reviews.text: This place is fabulous. From the moment you arrive you feel like you have stepped into another world. The grounds are beautiful and the hotel courtyard is one of the prettiest I've seen. Spa was wonderful. Traveling with girlfriends and we did a spa package with lunch! The Sunday brunch was so good. The hotel staff is amazing as well. They know the history of the town so well and can help you with ANYTHING you want to do. I highly recommend Rosewood San Miguel de Allende! I will Most definitely return to this magical place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent stay at Rosewood was as great as the first time. This time we stayed at a One Bedroom Colonial Suite and everything was perfect. I went with my husband to celebrate our first wedding anniversary, and the staff made sure that we felt special at all times.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hacienda, Outstanding Service, Lovely Views

reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Pamper yourself at the Rosewood San Miguel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s very large and beautifully decorated. You feel at home as soon as you walk in. Everything is impeccable, clean and tasteful. The bedroom is separated from a living room and working desk, with 40“ TV and fireplace. The shower is separated from the bath tub. The bathroom and closet are very spacious. The bed is VERY comfortable. The Italian linens are truly the best (where can I buy them?) and the ample terrace, which we used a lot, is simply delicious. Everything was absolutely perfect, from the candle holders, to the mirrors, marble floors, and decorations.
reviews.title: Beautiful worth the money
